predicate: If alpha (from bwp-dedicated_srs-config) is not absent, then msg3-alpha (from pusch-config_pusch-powercontrol) must be equal to alpha
notes: The rule is derived from the normative wording in the evidence provided. It states that if the alpha field is not absent, then the msg3-alpha field must be equal to the alpha field.

meta.evidence:
Dedicated alpha value for MsgA PUSCH. If the field is absent, the UE shall use the value of msg3-Alpha if configured, else UE applies value 1 (see TS 38.213 [13], clause 7.1.1).
---
configuration \{p0-pusch, alpha\} sets for PUSCH (except msg3 and msgA PUSCH), i.e., \{ \{p0,alpha,index1\}, \{p0,alpha,index2\},...\} (see TS 38.213 [13], clause 7.1). When no set is configured, the UE uses the P0-nominal for msg3 PUSCH, PO-UE is set to 0 and alpha is set according to msg3-Alpha configured for msg3 PUSCH.
---
- if \( P_{O_{-} N O M N A L \text { PUSCH, } f_{, c}}(0)=P_{O_{-} \text {PRE }}+\Delta_{\text {MsgA_PUSCH }} \) and msgA-Alpha is provided, \( \alpha_{b_{,} f_{, c}}(0) \) is the value of msgA-Alpha - elseif \( P_{\text {O_NOMINAL_PUSCH, } f, c}(0)=P_{\text {O_PRE }}+\Delta_{\text {PREAMBLE_Msg } 3} \) or msgA-Alpha is not provided, and msg3Alpha is provided, \( \alpha_{b, f, c}(0) \) is the value of msg3-Alpha

full_api_response.predicate: If alpha (from bwp-dedicated_srs-config) is not absent, then msg3-alpha (from pusch-config_pusch-powercontrol) must be equal to alpha
